rr.barrier
Class BarrierMonitor<T>

java.lang.Object
  rr.barrier.BarrierMonitor<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
rr.instrument.hooks.SpecialMethodListener
public class BarrierMonitor<T>
extends Object
implements rr.instrument.hooks.SpecialMethodListener

By default, the barrier classes used in the montecarlo and spec benchmarks are handled specially, since they include races that we'd often like to ignore. To handle barrier events, have your tool implement BarrierMonitor and create a new monitor in your Tool's constructor: 

                new BarrierMonitor(this, new DefaultValue() {
                        public BarrierState get(Object k) {
                                return new BarrierState(ShadowLock.get(k));
                        }
                });
This will cause the barrier event handlers to be called whenever a thread enters/exits a barrier, and each barrier will have an associated BarrierState that the tool can use to store whatever info it needs.
